articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: It was the first attack within city limits as Israel escalated hostilities against Iran's allies in the region.
articles.title: Apartment building in Beirut hit as Israel widens air campaign

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military on Monday released video of what it said was an unsafe maneuver by a Russian fighter jet near Alaska during an intercept by the U.S. military last week.
articles.title: US military slams 'unsafe' Russia fighter jet maneuver near Alaska

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: North Korea appeared on Monday to dismiss the possibility of a return to the personal diplomacy its leader Kim Jong Un had with former President Donald Trump, no matter who wins the Nov. 5 U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: North Korea appears to dismiss return to personal diplomacy with US

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: The far-right Freedom Party's historic victory in an Austrian parliamentary election has left it isolated and partly at the mercy of a powerful critic: the president, who must oversee efforts towards forming a viable coalition government.
articles.title: Austria's president takes charge as far right isolated after election victory

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Abdelhadi Ramahi
articles.description: The Amro family household in Lebanon's lush Keserwan mountains had become a refuge for families who wanted to stay outside the line of fire of creeping war in the country's south.
articles.title: Deadly Israeli strikes hit Lebanon's war displaced

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Emergency responders in North Carolina were racing to try to reach people who remain unaccounted for after the hurricane hit, killing nearly 100 people, wiping out communications and leaving millions without power.
articles.title: Hurricane Helene leaves dozens dead, many missing across US Southeast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the conscription of 133,000 new servicemen in Russia's autumn draft that starts Oct. 1 and goes until the end of the year, according to a Kremlin decree published on Monday.
articles.title: Putin orders conscription of 133,000 servicemen in Russia's autumn draft

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British foreign minister David Lammy repeated calls for an immediate ceasefire amid reports of a potential escalation in the Israel-Lebanon conflict, after discussing the matter with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken over the phone on Monday.
articles.title: UK's Lammy repeats calls for ceasefire after talk with Blinken on Middle East

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea's defence ministry denounced the United States' deployment of nuclear strategic assets in South Korea, state media KCNA reported on Tuesday, as Seoul was gearing up for a rare military parade marking Armed Forces Day.
articles.title: North Korea criticises US deployment of nuclear assets in South Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In his last morning press conference as Mexican president, Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador raffled off his watch on Monday to attending journalists in the kind of popular stunt that came to define his presidency.
articles.title: Mexico's Lopez Obrador raffles his watch in colorful final press conference
